articles.description: For the first time, scientist have traced a neutrino back to its source. “It’s a brand new vision on what's happening in the universe,” physicist Darren Grant said.
articles.title: In a cosmic first, scientists detect 'ghost particles' from a distant galaxy

articles.description: New York congressional candidate Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D) accused Rep. Joseph Crowley (D) of refusing to concede the Democratic primary race and mounting a third-party challenge against her.
articles.title: Ocasio-Cortez accuses defeated Dem of mounting third-party challenge
articles.author: Morgan Gstalter

articles.description: Wasco State Prison are investigating the death of Agustin Duran, 66, as a homicide, according to a Wednesday news release from the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation.
articles.title: Child molester beaten to death in California prison days after he arrived

articles.description: The Justice Department said it is reopening the investigation of Till's brutal 1955 death “after receiving new information.”
articles.title: Emmett Till's case has been reopened. His brutal death in 1955 put a spotlight on racial violence.

articles.description: Bill Clinton and Ronald Reagan placed second and third, respectively.

articles.description: An Icelandic whaling company has been accused of slaughtering an endangered blue whale in a "deplorable act", provoking anger and condemnation from the international marine conservationist community.
articles.title: 'Endangered blue whale' harpooned off coast of Iceland

articles.description: Papa John's founder John Schnatter has resigned as chairman of his company's board after admitting and apologizing for using the N-word during a May conference call.

articles.description: An Illinois police officer has resigned following criticism that he stood by as a man harassed a woman for wearing a shirt bearing a flag of Puerto Rico.
